title: letterpress
content:
my name is jonathan and almost done with my undergrad in GD. I’m trying to find a place where i can get a blind embossed for my business cards  
I found a couple of places but they say that it would take from 2 to 3 weeks  
any sugestin?

thanks

jonathan

 [‹ Great Type Resources?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907155135/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42799 "Go to previous forum topic") [Armenia interested or not ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907155135/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42704 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jlopezespinoza

comments.content:
Hello Jonathan,  
where are you coming from?  
Do you know Briar Press?  
 [http://www.briarpress.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907155135/http:/www.briarpress.org/ "http://www.briarpress.org/")

There you can find some letterpress printers ans their adds.  
If you are from Europe, I’ld recommand: [www.druckerey.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907155135/http:/www.druckerey.de/ "www.druckerey.de")  
Martin Z. Schroeder is a fine letterpress printer. Have a  
look into his photos with references:  
 [http://www.druckerey.de/02angebot.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907155135/http:/www.druckerey.de/02angebot.html "http://www.druckerey.de/02angebot.html")

Yes 2 up to 3 weeks is realistic. No, sorry, correction:  
its fast. Its another time dimension, not comparable with  
Mac’s World. Lots of steps of working includes manual human  
ressources and its not just a click on your mouse pad.  
Difficult to understand for a digital designer, but believe  
me: its just another dimension, not a question of “faster”  
or “slower”, or more or less hectic. Yes, difficult to  
understand. For now I have to leave. Since yesterday morning  
I am printing new charater sets. And ’til now just 30 out  
of 40 are ready... - ...yes, difficult to understand...  
difficult... (disapearing into my letterpress dimension...)

Georg  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
„Ich bin ein Preuße, kennt Ihr meine Farben...“
